intro: Gurania nigrescens, commonly known as the blackening gurania, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil and Peru. The plant is characterized by its dark green, slightly hairy leaves and showy, yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and somewhat elusive species.
